project.teaser: Technological breakthroughs empowered by enabling technologies hold a transformation potential that can be funneled to address industrial and societal grand challenges, like greening and digitalisation. To exploit this transformative potential, the innovation journey that...
project.objective: Technological breakthroughs empowered by enabling technologies hold a transformation potential that can be funneled to address industrial and societal grand challenges, like greening and digitalisation. To exploit this transformative potential, the innovation journey that leads new emerging technologies to their market-uptake shall embed since its early value-sensitive considerations, such as environmental and societal implications. With FORGING we propose a new methodology based on a value-sensitive innovation journey that breaks linear innovation trajectories to stimulate new technological visions and pathways attentive to the environment and society, and human-centred in alignment with Industry 5.0. technological frameworks. The value-sensitive innovation journey will be deployed in three phases: the technological uncovering with tech experts from academia and industry to detect early signals of emerging technologies; the societal confluence exploring the desirability and societal impact, and implications of novel technologies; the full-fledged co-creation opening to the broader community to develop concrete use cases for tech uptake. We will develop 6 Technological Pathways to transfer ideas and help industry navigate through issues related to the absorption and deployment of the use cases. FORGING methodology will be implemented by catalysing stakeholders’ community with 600 active members, from academia to industry, to CSS, to policy makers and to the broader society. We aim to organise 24 co-creation sessions, consultations with 20 policy bodies, 6 scenario workshops and Tech. and Innovation campaigns to drive tech. adoption. The FORGING Playbook and Toolbox will gather a set of facilitation guidance and materials for exploration, reflection, co-creation and evaluation of emerging technologies. These assets, jointly with the FORGING community, will sustain FORGING as a new flagship initiative on emerging enabling technologies.
project.title: Forum for Emerging Enabling Technologies in Support to the Digital and Green Transitions through Value Sensitive Innovations
project.keywords: Value-sensitive innovation, Design research, Horizon scanning, Future scenarios, Co-creation, RRI, Participatory research

result.title: Innovation journey map (final version)
result.description: A practical journey map laying out the implementation steps required to facilitate the innovation process with the active involvement of the forum participants towards the co-creation and pick-up of responsible enabling technologies. The report will consider the specificities of emerging enabling technologies and feedback gathered from evaluation (WP5) to identify changes and/or improvements needed.

result.title: Future scenarios report
result.description: Scenario narratives constructed as an outcome of the workshops organised in task 3.3. The defining criteria for scenario building will emerge as result from research in task 3.1 (horizon scanning) and task 3.2. (expert interviews to collect background information and prepare future scenarios).

result.title: Mapping of regional and EU Member States R&I priorities and programmes
result.description: Report identifying regional & national bodies from all over Europe in charge of R&I programming, key to foster the alignment between tech push and policy strategy.

result.title: Co-creation on emerging technologies - existing initiatives and success factors
result.description: Report gathering the outcomes of scouting of previous experiences of co-creation in the field of emerging technologies, capturing the very specific features and challenges of engagement and co-creation activities in the context of emerging/low TRL technologies.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - FORGING (Forum for Emerging Enabling Technologies in Support to the Digital and Green Transitions through Value Sensitive Innovations)
result.teaser: Europe is currently strong in many sectors, but to keep its industrial sovereignty, it must secure early leadership in new and emerging enabling technologies that are both socially and environmentally responsible. FORGING methodology comes in as a new approach to analyse the...

webItem.alternativeText: Emerging enabling technologies and challanges in their uptake

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Visualization of the future scenarios
result.description: Report analysing, refining, and visualizing the results from the T3.3 Scenario workshops. The refined future scenarios will serve as inspirational probes for future technological solutions and will be included in the FORGING co-creation toolbox.

result.title: Playbook and toolbox prototype
result.description: Forging Toolbox prototype - set of materials integrating the results of WP1, WP2 and WP3 to boost conversations and capture relevant information and insight about the analytical dimensions that FORGING uses to analyse emerging technologies in its work across pre-defined technological frameworks. This early release of the FORGING toolbox includes: tools (e.g., cavasses, cards, and other probes) a facilitation guide (Playbook), and a draft version of the Perspective Cards used in T2.4.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
